pullRequest.title: Add a new parameter "-string" to CFGVisualizeLauncher to print the string representation of the control flow graph.
pullRequest.bodyText: In the past, the CFGVisualizeLauncher can only generate the dot representation of the cfg (You can call CFGVisualizeLauncher.generateStringOfCFG() but there is no entry from the command line). Now we can use this parameter to print the string representation in the terminal.

commit.message: Now we can pass -string to make CFGVisualizeLauncher print string representation cfg.

nodes.bodyText:
What does "without analysis" mean?  It's here and in the method name.
I realize this phrase exists elsewhere in the code (it's not your invention), but I don't understand it in the other places and its documentation could be improved throughout.  Thanks!
javac -processor myProcessor -Aflowdotdir=. MyClass.java will do the dataflow analysis. So I think we should remove this line.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1892,6 +1892,7 @@
   \<-Acfgviz=org.checkerframework.dataflow.cfg.DOTCFGVisualizer,outdir=\emph{somedir}>.
   % TODO: create the directory if it doesn't exist.
   The directory must already exist.
+  The CFG is generated and output, but no dataflow analysis is performed.

nodes.bodyText: The same for here. CFGVisualizeLauncher is not used in this case.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1904,6 +1905,7 @@
   analyzed by the dataflow analysis (Section~\ref{creating-dataflow}).
   The graph also contains information about flow-sensitively refined
   types of various expressions at many program points.
+  The CFG is generated and output, but no dataflow analysis is performed.

commit.message:
Pull the latest code.
Resolve comments.
Put changelog entry in user-visible details

nodes.bodyText: To simplify the command, how about leaving off the -output command-line argument?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1926,7 +1927,7 @@
 java -Xbootclasspath/p:$CHECKERFRAMEWORK/checker/dist/javac.jar \
   -cp $CHECKERFRAMEWORK/checker/dist/checker.jar \
   org.checkerframework.dataflow.cfg.CFGVisualizeLauncher \
-  MyClass.java output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf
+  MyClass.java -output output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf

nodes.bodyText: To simplify the command, how about leaving off the -output command-line argument?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1937,17 +1938,29 @@
 \begin{Verbatim}
 java -cp $CHECKERFRAMEWORK/checker/dist/checker.jar \
   org.checkerframework.dataflow.cfg.CFGVisualizeLauncher \
-  MyClass.java output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf
+  MyClass.java -output output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf

nodes.bodyText: If you drop -output, you would need to adjust this text too.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1937,17 +1938,31 @@
 \begin{Verbatim}
 java -cp $CHECKERFRAMEWORK/checker/dist/checker.jar \
   org.checkerframework.dataflow.cfg.CFGVisualizeLauncher \
-  MyClass.java output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf
+  MyClass.java -output output/ -class MyClass -method test -pdf
 \end{Verbatim}
 \end{smaller}
 
 \end{itemize}
 
 \noindent
 The above command will generate the corresponding dot and pdf files for the
-method \code{test} in the class \code{MyClass} in the directory \<output>. For more
-information, run \refclass{dataflow/cfg}{CFGVisualizeLauncher} with no arguments to
-see the usage.
+method \code{test} in the class \code{MyClass} in the directory \<output>.

nodes.bodyText: This name suggests a file to me.  I would call it "--outputdir".

The command-line arguments to this program not follow the convention that - is for single-character flags and -- is for multi-character flags?  I think that would make the program easier to follow.
I realize this isn't your fault!  It could be fixed in this pull request or in a different pull request that is merged before this one.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,10 @@ Added an overloaded version of NullnessUtil.castNonNull that takes an error mess
 
 Added a new option `-Aversion` to print the version of the Checker Framework.
 
+New CFGVisualizeLauncher command-line arguments:
+ * `-outdir`: directory in which to write output files

nodes.bodyText: Use -- for all mentions of flags.
Mention that in general flags now use --.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,10 @@ Added an overloaded version of NullnessUtil.castNonNull that takes an error mess
 
 Added a new option `-Aversion` to print the version of the Checker Framework.
 
+New CFGVisualizeLauncher command-line arguments:
+ * `--outputdir`: directory in which to write output files
+ * `--string`: print the control flow graph in the terminal

@@ -116,6 +136,26 @@ protected void generateDOTofCFGWithoutAnalysis(
         generateDOTofCFG(inputFile, outputDir, method, clas, pdf, verbose, null);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Generate the String representation of the CFG for a method, only. Does no dataflow analysis
+     * analysis.
+     *
+     * @param inputFile java source input file
+     * @param method name of the method to generate the CFG for
+     * @param clas name of the class which includes the method to generate the CFG for
+     * @param verbose show verbose information in CFG
+     * @return the String representation of the CFG
+     */
+    protected @Nullable String generateStringOfCFGWithoutAnalysis(
